content.detailedDescription: Wow i  never thought id tell this story because i thought i was maybe seeing some kind of millitary craft being so close to bases and all.I live near dobbins afb.Well i was watching h2 and freaked when i saw the episode in england with the triangle shapped ufo in the woods and then they got a picture of it.Wow i freaked .Ok hear it is. i saw the same one .I no for a fact.I was in norcross at a storage unit when i just happend to look up and see a bright light like someones welding torch. it lasted about ten seconds.Then a super bright white vapor trail popped out of the bright light.The vapor trail was as wide as the black triangle that came out of the vapor trail.The vapor trail disapated as fast as it appeared.Out shoots this black triangle with a white yellow light in each corner of the craft with this reddish mesh like light in the middle.The lights were very dim because i figgured it just came throgh the stratisphere.It was way up there.So the thing had to be huge.After it came out of the vapor trail.It shot across the sky so fast and silent it was gone in about 2 seconds.Just how big i dont no but im guessing 300 ft or more.I no what i saw .I dont see things i got 20 12 vision.I no the differnce between ufo and aircraft spent whole life around aircraft.All i got to say is not a day goes by that i dont think about what i and many others just like me have seen.The possibillites are endless.After seeing those pictures ive been lost .Need some answers wow this has really ben messing with my head you no .Ty yall keep up the good work
content.summary: Black triangle ufo is ns

content.detailedDescription:
Around 10:23 to 10:25 pm, july 4, 2012. my wife susan and i were standing outside our door watching for neighbors��� fireworks. 

we observed two round orange glowing objects crossing west to east at around 30 to 40 degrees in the southern sky. there was no audible sound from them.

at first glimpse i thought they there were fireworks. then i noticed they appeared to be moving horizontally and round in shape. 

they remained in formation with one flying behind and below the one in front at all time as they passed from sight behind trees.

we watched the objects cross the sky for about 10 seconds or more. 

when i noticed they were in flight formation, my impression was i was witnessing similar objects seen by world war two aviators called ���foo fighters���.
content.summary: Two orange glowing orbs flew in formation east to west around 30 to 40 degrees in the southern sky.

content.detailedDescription: I was just going into my computer room to download 4th of july photos i had just taken. i kept hearing fireworks, so i decided to shut off the bedroom light, opened the blinds and looked out to my left at a 45 degree angle and saw a bright red glowing orb. i yelled to my husband "what is that red glowing object ih the sky?!" he jumped out of bed and ran to the window in our bedroom. he suggested we look from the back porch. we ran down the stairs to the back porch. by the time we got out on the porch, we saw 3 red/orange orbs angling toward us. there was no noise... but on occassion there was a firework or two. the 1st orb banked left and seemed to ascend into the atmosphere and just disappeared. the 2nd orb seemed to slow down as if to wait for the 3rd orb at which point the 3rd orb seemed to glow a brighter red and seemed to speed up. then the 2nd one followed the same path as the 1st orb and disappeared into atmosphere. the 3rd one seemed to hang around longer. it took a longer path closer to us and then, finally, banked left like the other 2 and just disappeared into the atmosphere. there was absolutely no noise of planes or anything except the fireworks intermitently. we just stood there in awe and watched entire thing... it lasted approximately 5-8 minutes.
content.summary: I saw 3 red glowing orbs  travelling on a path in my direction only to disappear into the atmosphere after a sharp left turn upward.

content.detailedDescription: I was just going into my computer room to download 4th of july photos i had just taken. i kept hearing fireworks, so i decided to shut off the bedroom light, opened the blinds and looked out to my left at a 45 degree angle and saw a bright red glowing orb. i yelled to my husband "what is that red glowing object ih the sky?!" he jumped out of bed and ran to the window in our bedroom. he suggested we look from the back porch. we ran down the stairs to the back porch. by the time we got out on the porch, we saw 3 red/orange orbs angling toward us. there was no noise... but on occassion there was a firework or two. the 1st orb banked left and seemed to ascend into the atmosphere and just disappeared. the 2nd orb seemed to slow down as if to wait for the 3rd orb at which point the 3rd orb seemed to glow a brighter red and seemed to speed up. then the 2nd one followed the same path as the 1st orb and disappeared into atmosphere. the 3rd one seemed to hang around longer. it took a longer path closer to us and then, finally, banked left like the other 2 and just disappeared into the atmosphere. there was absolutely no noise of planes or anything except the fireworks intermitently. we just stood there in awe and watched entire thing... it lasted approximately 5-8 minutes.
content.summary: I saw 3 red glowing orbs  travelling on a path in my direction only to disappear into the atmosphere after a sharp left turn upward.

content.detailedDescription: We were walking around my neighborhood watching fireworks in the sky, when all of a sudden we see an extremely fast moving, glowing red object, about the size of a star. what drew my attention was that the object never blinked, but did give off a red pulsating light, which seemed to dim around the edges of the object.It seemed to be travelling from west to east. my position was in utica, mi, looking south. at first, we passed it off as a satellite. once we continued walking towards my friend's townhouse, and got into the complex, we were not even 40ft. away from his door, when i looked up, i assumed, and pointed out that the object was back again, this time at a much lower altitude, and a slower speed, which almost seemed like a slow hover, again moving west to east. the object was so close that we were able to determine that it was not a fixed wing aircraft, since there was no green light on the opposite side, and that it also didn't blink, just pulsated a very bright red glow, which would alternate shades of red/orange. again, i was looking south, while my position was in utica, mi. the object gave off absolutely no sound, during which my first sighting i wouldn't have expected because of the altitude, but when i seen it for a second time, way closer, again, no sound, which would completely eliminate the idea that this was somehow a helicopter or airplane. my buddy did bring up those chinese lanterns, but the 1st sighting would rule that out, since it made it from horizon to horizon in about 8 seconds. and the much closer 2nd observation, would have revealed a yellow glow, and some structural definition, if it truly were a lantern. the one thing that really made my head spin, was when i attempted to take a photograph of the object through my phone's 8mp camera. the object would not show up at all, even when it was close by during our 2nd observation. when i returned home, my mother immediately said to me that she believed that she saw a ufo. so i asked her to describe it, and she gave me the same answers i gave for my 2nd observation. she has an iphone, and also tried taking pictures, which all turned out black. i have 3 more witnesses that were with me personally who all saw the object, plus my mother has three more witnesses who saw her sighting, which i believe was the same sighting i had for my 2nd observation. on top of it, my buddy who lives in sterling heights, which is south of utica, also saw two red objects, and the 2nd one also being much lower in altitude. he was also looking south, and reports that the object flew from west to east. for my 2nd observation, i would give an azimuth of 77 degrees, i'm telling you guys, that 2nd time i saw "it", this thing was close, and huge. and that's exactly what my buddy is saying, the only difference is he believes the object was bigger than what i saw, which i assume is because he was farther south than me, meaning he was closer. he described the size of the object to be the same as if you held a quarter out at arms length, while my 2nd observation would have been the size of a penny held at arms length. i saw the chinese lanterns that plagued the metro detroit area last july 4th, these were not those lanterns. i spread the word out right away last night to get some friends to look up, and see if someone could catch this thing on either video or picture. i also assume it wasn't showing up on our camera's, because it's spectral range was most likely closer to infrared.
content.summary: Bright red pulsating object, observed at high altitude and high speed at first, then low altitude, and at slow speed.

content.detailedDescription: I was standing on the street outside my home, watching the neighborhood fireworks. it was around 10:00 - 10:30 pm pst. i was looking to the west and i saw 3 redish-orange objects in the sky at about 50-60 degrees up.  they were traveling together (sort of v-type formation) and moving in a north to south direction. by the time i got 3 pictures and tried to get video, they all just slowly faded out of sight before my eyes.  they weren't fireworks (that were going vertical), these were traveling horizontal. i got 3 pictures on my phone.  they are a bit blurry, but you can see them in a sort of formation.  i was sort of excited to see something like that. i didn't know if they were making sounds because of all the fireworks going off around me.
content.summary: 3 steady redish-orange round objects in western sky slow travel n-s direction

content.detailedDescription: Was at the beach with over 200 people, the firework show had ended 20 minutes prior. i looked up into the sky and spotted a slow moving, what appeared to look like a fireball. i asked my sister and brother in law if they see it as well, which they did. we observed it for approx 6 to 6 minutes, on a somewhat straight path. it then just disappeared in a blink of an eyes time. sky was very clear, no clouds. everything was visible.
content.summary: Slow moving orange fireball then disappeared

content.detailedDescription: 7/4/2012 - last night at the fireworks in monroe, nc, while we were all waiting for the fireworks to start (which started late)  we all seen this red glow like plane or ship come out of now where like just hovering the charlotte area.  it looked like it wasn't moving, then quickly headed over us in monroe.  then it hovered a minute or two and disappeared.  everyone was in shock and talking about how this red glowing thing was heading toward us, and then when it just disappeared.
content.summary: Red glowing plane/ship hovered over charlotte area, then headed directly to monroe, hovered then disappeared before the fireworks started.

content.detailedDescription: @ 9:55 pm cdt my family and i were returning home from a fireworks show. as  we turned on the street we noticed a bright red light pulsating in the sky. we quickly pulled into the drive and got out of our car to watch the craft go over head. it was a bright red orb that glowed making it look somewhat fuzzy. the craft flew by not making a sound going from south to north. we watched it for a min or two and it was gone. i then noticed a second light coming from the south again. it was the same type of craft on the same flight path. we tried to film the second with an iphone. it was a poor quality video, but we do have it.
content.summary: 2 glowing red orbs spotted in overland park is july 4

content.detailedDescription: I live in andover, mn and right around the time fireworks began (cant remember if it was right before or after) and me and 4 other witnessed the very same object, it was flying fairly low compared to other sightings ive witnessed in the past but it was so close that it was literally mesmerizing. it was an orange/amber glowing sphere that looked like a ball of fire. it passed over us while we all were taking an evening swim so i quickly jumped out and turned on the lights for our pool and at night it makes the whole pool glow 7 different colors depending on the setting its on. i put it on the setting which makes it continuously change from one color to another hoping this would catch the attention of what ever was flying right above us.. im not sure if it worked but after it passed, a minute later it flew over in the same exact path as before. to make things even more strange after it passed the 2nd time it came back for a 3rd time just as before. only if my battery on my camera wasnt dead im sure i couldve filmed some pretty darn amazing footage, details and all, it was that close.
content.summary: Orange/amber glowing sphere, ball of fire, low flying across the sky, return 3 times within 5 min period

content.detailedDescription: I just dropped off my children at daycare in headingly, mb, located outside winnipeg and was on my way downtown. while driving on the busy street of portage ave, i stopped at a red light and noticed to the north-east direction what i thought was a plane off in the distance with contrails beginning to emit from the plane. it remained stationary and i continued to look up at the object as it now had my attention since it was not moving at all and the contrails looked frozen, or that there were no contrails being emitted anymore. it was pretty high above and far off so i'm not able to pinpoint how high or how far it was. minutes went by and the there was no movement from it until about 3-4 minutes afterwards, it appeared to get smaller. as it did, it formed into a perfect circle-like shape and it then disappeared in a blink of an eye. i'd like to end this by stating i'm presently a student enrolled at a law enforcement academy and that i report this anonymously. it is also my first sighting.
content.summary: Winnipeg daytime ufo

content.detailedDescription:
A friend and myself were watching fourth of july fireworks in the sky when we noticed an orange ball ascending in the sky from the north.  at that moment we determined that it might be a chinese lantern by the way it wobbled on upward lazily.  we doubted our first opinion on the object when it would suddenly pulsate a very bright white light.  when the white light dimmed, the object returned to it's orange orb like appearance.  the pulse was like a three second build up to a suddenly immense white light.  about five to seven seconds for every pulsation.  the object began to fly directly towards myself and my friend.  it got closer and seemed to move faster.  when it was just about directly overhead, i made a joke that what we were seeing was superman.  i made the joke because directly overhead it didn't appear to be an orb anymore it appeared to be a capital y flying across the sky like superman with his arms out.  at the ends of the three points of the y were orange orbs.  the rest of the y was pulsating a yellowish white to an all white flash at it's peak.  at this time when it was directly overhead we expected to be able to see it clearly for a while, but then it sped up quickly.  in about a few short seconds it was something so visible to something so tiny as a little star moving across the sky until it wasn't visible anymore.  i saw it shortly in it's tiniest form, to my friend's perspective it vanished.                

my best guess it flew from the north towards us in the south and then vanished.
content.summary: Orange orb in distance pulsated bright white flew overhead and appeared to be a flying capital y with orange orbs at the points

content.detailedDescription:
Watching the fireworks downtown grand rapids mi. 
the main site of launcing the fireworks was directly in front of us, the view was between 2 buildings. will call that 12 oclock position. during an small pause in the show, between launchings, noticed a pulsing red orb in the distance moving directly horizontal in the sky, at about the 3'oclock location on the other side of one of the buildings. my first thought was an errant launch or flare from the show, but noticed it moving at very strange slow speed and direclty horizontal..With no up-down movement, like a firework or flare falling would have. i knew from the glow that it wasnt a plane or helicopter.
it then passed from view behind another set of buildings. i normally would just let that go as a wierd firework anomally, untill another witness (also there for the firework show) next to me, that i didnt know, commented on it. saying that it was a ufo, after i was thinking the exact same thing. wasnt in a position to run around the buildings to continue to view, as i was with a date at the time.
it was a very quick view, but thought i would share.
content.summary: Red orb during firework show..Obvious not a firework.

content.detailedDescription: This is a duplicate post. the video could not be attached to the first one but is attached to this one. i was walking east on 78th street to third avenue in bay ridge, brooklyn at 10:38pm on july 4th, 2012. the color, light and motion of the object immediately caught my eye. it was a pulsating red and orange orb. since i witnessed the meteor streak across the wisconsin sky in april of 2010 i am particularly attuned to celestial phenomena. this was something different. unlike the meteor or even a firework its motion was not constant. it was choppy and appeared to start and stop and change directions. i had a small video camera on me and was able to capture a few seconds of the object in the sky. however there was too much artificial light interference and obstructions like trees and tall buildings for the video to be good. the video is in slow motion at about half speed. the object can be seen at 10 seconds and again at 20 and 25 seconds.
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Pulsating orb bay ridge, brooklyn

content.detailedDescription: I was walking east on 78th street to third avenue in bay ridge, brooklyn at 10:38pm on july 4th, 2012. the color, light and motion of the object immediately caught my eye. it was a pulsating red and orange orb. since i witnessed the meteor streak across the wisconsin sky in april of 2010 i am particularly attuned to celestial phenomena. this was something different. unlike the meteor or even a firework its motion was not constant. it was choppy and appeared to start and stop and change directions. i had a small video camera on me and was able to capture a few seconds of the object in the sky. however there was too much artificial light interference and obstructions like trees and tall buildings for the video to be good. the video is in slow motion at about half speed. the object can be seen at 10 seconds and again at 20 and 25 seconds.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Bay ridge, brooklyn july 4th 2012

content.detailedDescription: On july 4th, 2012 i was outside with my family enjoying the evening before the late night fireworks started. the fireworks were due to start around 10:15-10:30. around 8:30-9 pm, i had glanced in the sky and saw two flying objects that had an orangish/yellow appearance. they were circular but i could not identify what they were. i called my mother and father in law outside for them to help me identify. the objects would fly very fast, then slow down and hover in the sky, then pick up speed again. out of nowhere three more appeared behind the first two, flying in the same kind of chaotic change of direction path. the objects eventually completely dimmed out, but we could still see the black outlines/shadow of the objects. i was so confused on what they were, i started researching my newspaper and internet the next day to get some answers. i found over 100 reported sightings of the same thing i had witnessed; with the same details!
content.summary: Flying objects spotted with dimming lights

content.detailedDescription: I was walking my dog listening to the fireworks in my area. i kept looking up to see the show but too many trees are in my neighborhood. however at one last glance, i noticed a reddish glow moving through the sky slowly. i thought maybe it was a plane but then the shape was more oval and seemed to have soft edges without any flashing lights. the glow was steady and did not dissappear. then it stopped moving and hovered for about one minute in one spot then soon dissappeared. i always thought the universe was too large to think we were the only ones here. now i know we are not alone. my thought was that either they thought we were at war or maybe they just wanted to watch the show from the best view ever. from the sky!
content.summary: Red/orange glow that was moving. thought this was a firework then it hovered and then dissapeared.

content.detailedDescription:
My daughter was laying on her back in the yard looking up and asked me what that was flying over the house.  i was bbq'ing and looked up after a few seconds and noticed was looked like a long cyliner shaped object with no wings flying at a fairly fast rate in the clear sky.  it was traveling south to north passing over the woodinville, wa area.  i never changed path or altitude for as far as i could see it.  again it had no wings, it had a reflective character to it and silent.  

i know there have been some reports of many orbs on july 4th in the area, but was curious if anyone knows what i saw.  i typically see aiplanes fly east to west at a fairly low altitude always emitting noise.  this was a non-typical flight path and silent.
content.summary: Shiny non-winged object flying south-north in a straight path seattle area

content.detailedDescription: I stepped outside my home around 11pm to let my dog out before bed.  i'm an avid sky watcher and i happened to look up in a slightly ese direction.  at first i noticed what i thought was the iss flying over because i like to watch it as often as i can with binoculars and to the unaided eye it appears to be the brightest star in the sky as it is moving.  i have since checked though and the iss wasn't due to make a visible flyover in lockport, ny last night.  i'm assuming it may have been a satellite?  almost at the same time i noticed a very large bright orange "shape" following the "satellite."  it was roundish in shape but irregular.  you could obviously tell that it wasn't perfectly round or sphere shaped.  at first i thought it was a plane but it only took about 2 seconds to completely discount that aspect.  i also discounted that it might have been a chinese lantern.  it deliberately followed the path of the "satellite."  what i keep referring to as a possible satellite visually appeared to be nothing other  than what a satellite appears to be when viewed from the ground......."a moving star."  at all times the ufo exactly followed the same flight path(which was mostly straight) of the "satellite," maintaining the same distance.  after approximately 30 seconds both objects disappeared suddenly and completely. it moved in a southerly direction.  i've only seen one other ufo in my life so i was quite excited while at the same time trying to make note of all details that i could.  at first i was hesitant to talk about it but i happened to mention it to a good friend that i communicate regularly with on facebook and he posted the following reply to me:  "this was posted on the local news station here in tulsa, oklahoma facebook page....Any one else see a strange orange light move soundlessly across the sky from ssw to nne last night about 9:45. i had another friend see it and said it was 5 orange lights when it came by her..It was moving as fast as a plane, but it wasn't a plane."  now tulsa is a long ways from here but it sure seemed that it might not be a coincidence.  i'm sorry i don't have alot of evidence.  i have no camera and my cell phone won't take photos at night.
content.summary: Huge round yet irregularly shaped orange object following what appeared to be a satellite.

content.detailedDescription: My eleven-year old son was watching fireworks from our back deck between the hours of 9:30 to 10 p.M. when he called me and his dad to come outside because our son  saw some lights. it was approximately 10:05 when we joined him on deck. i didn���t think much about it because it was the fourth of july; however, he pointed out four unusual red/orange lights that hovered in unison from the east to west direction. our back deck faces north. it was peculiar to see these lights drifting slowly from east to west against the night sky when there were plenty of fireworks. the first three set of lights formed a trianglular shape with the fourth trailing behind. we then called our oldest 17-year old son to see these lights and ask what he thought about them. shortly after he came to see them we noticed that the first three set of lights in a triangle shape lost the first bottom left light, as it simply disappeared. our 17-year old also agreed how odd the lights appeared. we noticed some airplanes to the southeast and we could hear their engines slightly. the remaining three lights continued to hover together and kept at the same distance for some time. the lights began to trail behind a set of trees so my eleven-year old son and i came down from the deck to move to the east part of our yard to visually follow the lights after they began to go behind the trees (to the north of us). we then noticed only one light left, and that last light mysteriously dissappeared before it fully went behind the trees. my eleven-year old son and i went further into the east section of our yard to see the light before it completely went behind the trees, but then we noticed that it too disappeared. what was peculiar is that after i stood there for a while looking towards the sky where the lights were, i noticed a round ring in the sky that sort of looked like a white aura or white glowy circle of smoke. my eleven-year old son explained to me later what prompted him to call us. he said that as he was watching the fireworks on our back deck he noticed one light hovering still in the sky. he thought nothing of it, and continued watching fireworks; however, when he turned and noticed the light he noticed the three additional lights joining and hovering along with what became the tail light. this was the first sighting of two this particular evening.
content.summary: Four red-orange lights: three in triangle with fourth trailing behind, later one of the three dissappearing and the fourth joining to form triangle.

content.detailedDescription: I first observed these objects when i went outside to watch fireworks last night. i notice when fireworks were going a redish/orange ball and then noticed a second one not far behind it. i then went to the back of my house and saw about 6-10 coming from a completely different direction with one behind the other and there were a couple of planes in the area at the time. the last ones i noticed were completely red, they were not just floating like a chinese lantern you could clearly tell something intelligent was controlling them. they were also way to bright to be a floating lantern they were about as bright as a plane headlight considering they were shining perfectly threw a decent amount of smoke from all the fire works going off.
content.summary: Bright redish orange balls that were all over the place

content.detailedDescription: Saw an abnormaly bright, orange orb moving across sky.  it stopped and hovered for about 40 seconds, then changed direction and traveled in opposite direction before disappearing behind dark clouds.
content.summary: Orange, pulsating orb flying in different directions.

content.detailedDescription:
Between 8:15pm and 8:45pm i was looking at the western sky and saw a shiny object in flight it didn't last long. i few minutes i saw another and told my wife to look at it too by the clouds...She looked at the wrong clouds saw nothing. she saw the next one and told me to look!!! and the 4th went by shortly after.
granted there are a lot of jets flying by because charlotte int airport is nearby....But when we see them they disappear over the horizon and always leave a trail behind them...These 4 objects just disappeared.
they traveled in a straight line in the exact same path as the previous ones.
content.summary: Between 8:15pm and 8:45pm i was looking at the western sky and saw a shiny object in flight it didn't last long. i few minutes i saw another and told my wife to look at it too by the clouds...She looked at the wrong clouds saw nothing. she saw the next 2

content.detailedDescription:
i was at work in a parking lot near the indian river
inlet near rehoboth beach, de. at about 2am.  i looked up toward the inlet
and saw three craft, one behind the other, at about 1500 to 2000 feet agl (i
am a private pilot so i can judge this pretty closely).  they were about 1/2
to 1 mile away from me on an east to west flight path.  they were absolutely
quiet.  the red lights on either end of the vehicle stayed on all the time
and the white lights blinked in a seemingly random fashion.  the white
lights did not send out a beam of light, they just lighted up and went off
randomly.  while i watched i tried to figure out if the lights were on a
straight wing or a swept wing or whatever but i could not see any outline of
the craft, just the lights.  i thought that since they seemed to be on a
flight path that would take them almost directly over me that if i waited
until they went overhead i might be able to see a shape.  i shined my extra
strong flashlight at them to see if i could get either a view of the shape
or a response from them.  
suddenly the second craft in the line seemed to wiggle it's wings? and then
dropped down below the first craft and came up next to it for a few minutes
and then seemed to start to descend directly toward me.  i thought "great,
if it comes lower and right over me i should be able to get a good look at
the shape of it".  as it descended toward me i was waiting for it to pass
overhead.  
when i told people about this happening i did not even think about the shape
of it was. 
it was about six months later when i started to think about the shape and
why i didn't see it go overhead.  i slowly realized that the last thing i
remembered was it descending toward me and then i was driving around my
patrol area.  
i don't know what happened! did i get an emergency call and have to leave
before it descended? if so, i have no recollection of getting the call.  did
i just forget about them being there and leave before it descended and/or
passed overhead?  i was excited about seeing the shape, and i do not
remember leaving the parking lot.

have you heard of any craft that looked like this?  what do you think may
have happened about why i remember so little of the event after it started
to descend toward me?
content.summary: Saw 3 unknown craft with red lights on end of (wing) on all the time and white lights in between (about 10-12) that glowed randomly but did not emit any beam of light. one descended toward me and i don''t remember what happened after that.

content.detailedDescription: Looked up and saw what i thought was a star. i was standing outside with some friends and just joking around i said look ufo! and then the light changed it's path slightly then got very bright and dimmed back down and eventually disappeared into the dark of night.The color and object looked like a star blueish-white. it was the first ufo sighting i have ever seen in person and it was kind of freaky seeing it.
content.summary: Looked up thought it was a star then brightened, changed path, dimmed then disappeared.

content.detailedDescription:
My sister, her boyfriend, and myself witnessed a orange glowing object that was moving quickly and then stop on a dime and ascend into the clouds out of sight just before it came back down into viewing distance.

i am seeing that many of you are experiances the same phenomenon and would love to hear your personal story. this may be a strange coincident or something is really happening. i have never believed in ufo's until last night. i an confirm this object was neither a plane or helicopter.
content.summary: Ufo sighting- orange glowing object july 4th, 2012

content.detailedDescription:
My sister, her boyfriend, and myself witnessed a orange glowing object that was moving quickly and then stop on a dime and ascend into the clouds out of sight just before it came back down into viewing distance.

i am seeing that many of you are experiances the same phenomenon and would love to hear your personal story. this may be a strange coincident or something is really happening. i have never believed in ufo's until last night. i an confirm this object was neither a plane or helicopter.
content.summary: Ufo sighting- orange glowing object july 4th, 2012

content.detailedDescription:
Went out to close the garage...And this was during the clawson 4th of july fireworks. usually you can't see the show from our house because of the treeline and distance...But there was a stray firework which lit up close enough to the house to see. i watched a light continue flying (through the light of the firework) and expected it to explode (thinking it was a stray as well) but it kept flying. the light was an orb in shape...Orange and yellowish...Pulsating somewhat (although hard to tell at night because bright lights wobble anyway) but neither diminishing nor increasing in color. it also didin't change direction and i followed its path with my eyes (which took me to the front of my house)...And i watched for at least 30 seconds until it was so far i could no longer see it. the object was flying from west to east and i would guess 30-40 degrees from where i stood. as i walked back to the garage...A second one flew by...Same speed and distnace parameters and like the other...No sound.

neither orb changed direction and both were large enough to have me think they were a plane circling to land at the troy airport...But again the objects had no sound and no jet stream of any sort.

that's the sum of it.

i didn't think ufo at all...Because there didn't seem to be anything startge other than the lack of souond. you know...No funny angles or hovering or "close encounters" music. but it was different enough for me to want to follow it and see where it flew and whether it would do anything funky.
content.summary: Saw two orbs during fireworks show. thought it was astray, but kept flying until i could no longer see it

content.detailedDescription:
My wife and mother-in-law were sitting with me in a large crowd prior to watching the city of mount vernon���s 4th of july fireworks display about 10:00 pm at edgewater park in west mount vernon, when i noticed a fairly large, pulsating reddish-orange orb slowly approaching from the northeast.  i assumed it was just an airplane or helicopter, so i went back to watching the citizens of the area light off their personal fireworks prior to the main event and lost track of the object.

a few minutes later, the three of us together noticed three more orbs, like the first one i had seen, in an uneven tandem formation approaching the area very slowly from the south.  i thought they might be helicopters because of the formation���s very slow speed, and so i continued to chat with my wife and mother-in-law while we watched the orbs.  after the formation slowed almost to a hover about a mile away, the lead object slowly turned right to the east while the other two remained approximately in place.  as the lead object slowly proceeded on its new trajectory, it gradually transitioned from a pulsating reddish-orange color to a smaller solid-whitish light until it seemed to disappear.  my wife said something about ���ufos,��� and even someone in the crowd behind us remarked that they might be ufos, but i still continued to think they had to be aircraft.  but, what puzzled me was the oversize pulsating reddish-orange color and the lack of a standard aircraft position lighting scheme of small, solid red and green lights with a white strobe.  when the fireworks show began, our attention was transferred to the spectacular display and the orbs were forgotten.

after taking my mother-in-law home, my wife and i were east-bound on memorial hwy (sr 536) driving back to our trailer in west mount vernon, when my wife noticed a single reddish-orange pulsating orb off to the south less than a mile away.  we pulled our car off to the side of the road and stopped to get out of our car and better observe the object���s behavior.  the soundless orb was slowly paralleling the road in a straight line about 500 feet in the air when it gradually morphed to a small point of white light before it went behind a tree that blocked our view.  we excitedly left for home after we were unable to find it again.

when we got home, we searched the sky outside for about 10 minutes to see if we could observe any more of the objects, but we failed to see anything other than two separate aircraft (we could see their familiar outline) fly by with their trademark white strobe-light with red and green position-lights.  

none of us had ever seen anything like those large, silent, pulsating, reddish-orange orbs of light before!
content.summary: Three red, pulsating orbs in the sky slowly approached a crowd of people in uneven formation, and two turned away and changed color to white.

content.detailedDescription:
While a friend of mine and myself were sitting outside waiting for the fireworks to start on the stripe at geneva on the lake. from the corner of my eye i noticed a bright red light. a fireball looking object that at first moved quickly across the sky in a southern direction towards the city of geneva. the further it got the slower and dimmer the light got. it would change from a bright red to an orange before it would completely disappear. when the first one appeared i thought it was just a stray firework. since it was the 4th. it wasn't until a third appeared from the same direction that i pointed it out to my friend. the third light came out from the lake and once it got to a area of threes the two previous lights i had seen before lit back up. the two were quite a ways off but the third light then went in the direction of the other two lights and then all three disappeared again. two or three more red lights exactly like the previous appeared from the lake direction and made their way across the sky before disappearing. this went on all through the firework display. we only lost sight of the objects when the lights would completely disappear. it was hard to say exactly what they looked like but the were very bright at first and would blink and change to orange before they would disappear. i would say they were a diamond shaped light. 

i felt incredibly unease and it wasn't till when the third light had appeared and the previous two lighting back up when i got legitimately concerned. from the crowd i think there were only two or three other people that seemed to notice the lights.
content.flightPath: Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: About 6 red lights coming from the lake going in a southern direction
